com.linkedin.math.bigFloat
Class BigFloatCodec

java.lang.Object
  com.linkedin.math.bigFloat.BigFloatCodec

public class BigFloatCodec
extends java.lang.Object

Algorithms to convert a binary floating point number to or from a printable (but not readily understandable) String. No information is lost in conversion. The natural ordering of the strings is the same as the natural ordering of the corresponding numbers. The string representation is reasonably compact, and the conversion algorithms are reasonably fast.

The string representation is the hexadecimal encoding of:

  • 4 bits (one hex character) encoding the sign and range:
    • 0: negative NaN with a positive payload
    • 1: negative NaN with a negative payload
    • 3: NEGATIVE_INFINITY
    • 4: negative significand with positive exponent
    • 5: negative significand with negative exponent
    • 7: NEGATIVE_ZERO
    • 8: ZERO
    • a: positive significand with negative exponent
    • b: positive significand with positive exponent
    • c: INFINITY
    • e: positive NaN with a negative payload
    • f: positive NaN with a positive payload
  • the exponent, encoded as follows:
    • if the significand is negative, invert the exponent (~ operator) and, if the significand is one (no fractional bits), add 1 (+ operator)
    • encode the absolute value, using Levenshtein encoding
    • append 0 bits to a multiple of 4 bits
    • if the significand is negative or the exponent is negative but not both, invert the bits (~ operator)
  • the fractional bits of the significand, in two's complement representation, with 0 bits appended to a multiple of 4 bits
A NaN is encoded as though it were a power of 2 (no fractional bits) with the payload in place of the exponent.

encodeInteger

public void encodeInteger(java.lang.StringBuilder into,
                          java.math.BigInteger n)
Encode an integer, using Levenshtein encoding, with zero bits appended to a multiple of 4 bits. If the given number is negative, encode its absolute value and invert the encoded bits. Finally, convert to hexadecimal.

decodeInteger

public java.math.BigInteger decodeInteger(java.lang.CharSequence from)
Decode an exponent or NaN payload.
